name: Strange, Strange People Quiz | People | 10 Questions

questions.text: Everyone has heard of Lizzie Borden. What happened to her?
options: She was never brought to trial
questions.explanation:
She was tried and acquitted.

	Insufficient evidence!

questions.text: Which King of the United Kingdom lost the American colonies to independence before succumbing to a serious mental illness?
questions.explanation:
George III.

	A long life, but ...

questions.text: Joe McCarthy, creator of 'McCarthyism', seems to satisfy the definition of paranoia. What state did he represent in the Senate?
questions.explanation:
Wisconsin.

	How many lives did he ruin?

questions.text: Which Roman emperor murdered his wife and his mother?
questions.explanation:
Nero.

	He may not have fiddled while Rome burned, but he did see himself as an artist - like a notorious 20th century dictator with a moustache and wild gestures.

questions.text: Which emperor had a strong attachment to his sister (he was also known for his cruelty and insanity)?
questions.explanation:
Caligula.

	His name today is synonymous with depravity.

questions.text: Which emperor, also quite probably mad, considered renaming Rome before he was ultimately killed?
questions.explanation:
Commodus.

	Roman history was certainly colorful.

questions.text: The instability suffered by which actress may have some connection with the fact that her mother spent many years in an asylum?
questions.explanation:
Marilyn Monroe.

	Sad story all the way around.

questions.text: The wife of which author also spent many years in an asylum?
This self-proclaimed 'wise man' was famous for his debauchery (among other things). Ultimately, he was murdered. Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Rasputin.

	He wasn't an easy man to kill - it took some doing to get it done.

questions.text: Howard Hughes is now known more for his madness than for his wealth or accomplishment. What movie studio did he at one time control?
questions.explanation:
RKO.

	I guess money doesn't always buy happiness.
